page.title: 09Coleton Fishacre,gardens.
page.content: The garden is 18 acres and is acid soil.They grow plants from all over the world because the soil is so rich.The garden has 500 pine trees planted around it to protect it from salt in the air.These trees have reached maturity and are now dying.This is a problem for the National Trust.Mr.Taylor told us all the Latin names of the plants.By the stream was a massive-leafed Gunnera from Brazil,it looks like a giant rhubarb leaf but is no relation to it.There was a tree from South-East China called Metasequoia,it is 35 years old,about 20m tall and is thought to be a survivor of the Dinosaur Age.A Wellingtonia tree is useless,you can't burn or build with it,its trunk and branches are spongey.
